Justification: To evaluate for gynecological causes of lower abdominal pain such as ovarian cysts, ectopic pregnancy, or other pelvic pathology.
To rule out pregnancy, including ectopic pregnancy, as a cause of lower abdominal pain in a sexually active female.
To check for signs of infection or inflammation, such as elevated white blood cell count, which could indicate appendicitis or pelvic inflammatory disease.
To rule out urinary tract infection or other urinary causes of abdominal pain.
To rule out sexually transmitted infections that could cause pelvic inflammatory disease and lower abdominal pain.
To assess for any electrolyte imbalances that could be contributing to the patient's symptoms.
